clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Virtual Reality Training by Novices on Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy in a Porcine Model
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Virtual Reality Training by Novices on Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy in a Porcine Model

brief_summary.textblock: This study proposes evaluation of an educational tool, a laparoscopic virtual reality simulator. The purpose of this study is to determine whether training on the LapSim Simulator transfers to improved laparoscopic cholecystectomy operative performance in an animal model.

detailed_description.textblock: This is study protocol involves the training and evaluation of general surgery interns on a laparoscopic simulator (LapSim®, Surgical Science Ltd, Göteborg, Sweden, version 3.0.

primary_outcome.measure: Score on Global Outcomes Assessment of Laparoscopic Skills

arm_group.description: Virtual reality laparoscopic simulator training: Residents will participate in a structured approach to teaching laparoscopic skills to beginning surgeons with a virtual reality trainer will improve skills prior to actual operative experience.

intervention.description: The aim of this project is to determine whether a structured approach to teaching laparoscopic skills to beginning surgeons with a virtual reality trainer will improve skills prior to actual operative experience. We aim to show that with the virtual reality trainer, operative skills will be improved and that overall operative time will be decreased.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Surgical interns (PGY 1) are eligible
- Twenty-five (25) participants will comprise this group
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior clinical experience with laparoscopic surgery as the assistant surgeon.
- Prior simulation training (mechanical, PC-based or otherwise).
